segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 10
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 10

segments.pli: 21. Karajakāyavagga
segments.en: 21. The Body Born of Deeds

segments.pli: 216. Saṃsappanīyasutta
segments.en: 216. Creepy Creatures

segments.pli: “Saṃsappanīyapariyāyaṃ vo, bhikkhave, dhammapariyāyaṃ desessāmi.
segments.en: “Mendicants, I will teach you an exposition of the teaching on creepy creatures.

segments.pli: Taṃ suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
segments.en: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”

segments.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ.
segments.en: “Yes, sir,” they replied.

segments.pli: Bhagavā etadavoca:
segments.en: The Buddha said this:

segments.pli: “Katamo ca, bhikkhave, saṃsappanīyapariyāyo dhammapariyāyo?
segments.en: “What is the exposition of the teaching on creepy creatures?

segments.pli: Kammassakā, bhikkhave, sattā kammadāyādā kammayonī kammabandhū kammapaṭisaraṇā, yaṃ kammaṃ karonti—
segments.en: Sentient beings are the owners of their deeds and heir to their deeds. Deeds are their womb, their relative, and their refuge.

segments.pli: kalyāṇaṃ vā pāpakaṃ vā—tassa dāyādā bhavanti.
segments.en: They shall be the heir of whatever deeds they do, whether good or bad.

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco pāṇātipātī hoti luddo lohitapāṇi hatapahate niviṭṭho, adayāpanno sabbapāṇabhūtesu.
segments.en: Take a certain person who kills living creatures. They’re violent, bloody-handed, a hardened killer, merciless to living beings.

segments.pli: So saṃsappati kāyena, saṃsappati vācāya, saṃsappati manasā.
segments.en: They’re creepy in body, speech, and mind.

segments.pli: Tassa jimhaṃ kāyakammaṃ hoti, jimhaṃ vacīkammaṃ, jimhaṃ manokammaṃ, jimhā gati, jimhupapatti.
segments.en: Doing crooked deeds by way of body, speech, and mind, their destiny and rebirth is crooked.

segments.pli: Jimhagatikassa kho panāhaṃ, bhikkhave, jimhupapattikassa dvinnaṃ gatīnaṃ aññataraṃ gatiṃ vadāmi—
segments.en: Someone whose destiny and rebirth is crooked is reborn in one of two places, I say:

segments.pli: ye vā ekantadukkhā nirayā yā vā saṃsappajātikā tiracchānayoni.
segments.en: in an exclusively painful hell, or among the species of creepy animals.

segments.pli: Katamā ca sā, bhikkhave, saṃsappajātikā tiracchānayoni?
segments.en: And what are the species of creepy animals?

segments.pli: Ahi vicchikā satapadī nakulā biḷārā mūsikā ulūkā, ye vā panaññepi keci tiracchānayonikā sattā manusse disvā saṃsappanti.
segments.en: Snakes, scorpions, centipedes, mongooses, cats, mice, owls, or whatever other species of animal that creep away when they see humans.

segments.pli: Iti kho, bhikkhave, bhūtā bhūtassa upapatti hoti.
segments.en: This is how a being is born from a being.

segments.pli: Yaṃ karoti tena upapajjati.
segments.en: For your deeds determine your rebirth,

segments.pli: Upapannamenaṃ phassā phusanti.
segments.en: and when you’re reborn contacts affect you.

segments.pli: Evamahaṃ, bhikkhave, ‘kammadāyādā sattā’ti vadāmi.
segments.en: This is why I say that sentient beings are heirs to their deeds.

segments.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco adinnādāyī hoti … pe …
segments.en: Take someone else who steals …

segments.pli: kāmesumicchācārī hoti …
segments.en: commits sexual misconduct …

segments.pli: musāvādī hoti …
segments.en: lies …

segments.pli: pisuṇavāco hoti …
segments.en: speaks divisively …

segments.pli: pharusavāco hoti …
segments.en: speaks harshly …

segments.pli: samphappalāpī hoti …
segments.en: indulges in talking nonsense …

segments.pli: abhijjhālu hoti …
segments.en: is covetous …

segments.pli: byāpannacitto hoti …
segments.en: has cruel intentions …

segments.pli: micchādiṭṭhiko hoti viparītadassano:
segments.en: has wrong view …

segments.pli: ‘natthi dinnaṃ … pe …
sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedentī’ti.
So saṃsappati kāyena, saṃsappati vācāya, saṃsappati manasā.
segments.en: They’re creepy in body, speech, and mind.

segments.en: Doing crooked deeds by way of body, speech, and mind, their destiny and rebirth is crooked.

segments.en: And what are the species of creepy animals?

segments.en: Snakes, scorpions, centipedes, mongooses, cats, mice, owls, or whatever other species of animal that creep away when they see humans.

segments.en: Sentient beings are the owners of their deeds and heir to their deeds. Deeds are their womb, their relative, and their refuge.

segments.pli: kalyāṇaṃ vā pāpakaṃ vā—tassa dāyādā bhavanti.
segments.en: They shall be the heir of whatever deeds they do, whether good or bad.

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco pāṇātipātaṃ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti nihitadaṇḍo nihitasattho, lajjī dayāpanno sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampī viharati.
segments.en: Take a certain person who gives up killing living creatures. They renounce the rod and the sword. They’re scrupulous and kind, living full of compassion for all living beings.

segments.pli: So na saṃsappati kāyena, na saṃsappati vācāya, na saṃsappati manasā.
segments.en: They’re not creepy in body, speech, and mind.

segments.pli: Tassa uju kāyakammaṃ hoti, uju vacīkammaṃ, uju manokammaṃ, uju gati, ujupapatti.
segments.en: Doing virtuous deeds by way of body, speech, and mind, their destiny and rebirth is virtuous.

segments.pli: Ujugatikassa kho panāhaṃ, bhikkhave, ujupapattikassa dvinnaṃ gatīnaṃ aññataraṃ gatiṃ vadāmi—
segments.en: Someone whose destiny and rebirth is virtuous is reborn in one of two places, I say:

segments.pli: ye vā ekantasukhā saggā yāni vā pana tāni uccākulāni khattiyamahāsālakulāni vā brāhmaṇamahāsālakulāni vā gahapatimahāsālakulāni vā aḍḍhāni mahaddhanāni mahābhogāni pahūtajātarūparajatāni pahūtavittūpakaraṇāni pahūtadhanadhaññāni.
segments.en: in a heaven of perfect happiness, or in an eminent well-to-do family of aristocrats, brahmins, or householders—rich, affluent, and wealthy, with lots of gold and silver, lots of property and assets, and lots of money and grain.

ye imañca lokaṃ parañca lokaṃ sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedentī’ti.

segments.pli: Chaṭṭhaṃ.
